poem:
**End of the Ladder**

Banks huddle, whispered schemes now thinning,  
as morning breaks on roofs yet unbought.  
Promises dance in mortgage dreams,  
where keys and doors and bricks collide—  
ninety-five ways to float, or fall,  
all testament to hopes and hands,  
as guarantees ash on autumn air,  
ladders pulled from the sky.
